comments.en:
Driver for color PCL 6 printers, much faster than the "lj5gray"/"lj5mono" drivers.

The "pxlmono" and the "pxlcolor" driver are the same code, the difference is only that the "pxlcolor" gives colour and the "pxlmono" grayscale output. This entry for the "pxlcolor" driver lists only color printers. See the "pxlmono" driver entry for monochrome printers.

Due to a bug in Ghostscript Duplex does not work with the "pxlmono" and the "pxlcolor" drivers. Here is a patch for GPL Ghostscript 8.63. This patch is needed so that the Duplex option of the PPDs from this site works. Setting Duplex with PJL commands does not work.

The resolution must be given both with the "-r" option on the command line of Ghostscript and as PJL command. Here is a patch for GPL Ghostscript 8.63 so that giving the PJL commands is not necessary any more.

The PPDs from this site use an ugly Perl workaround to patch Ghostscript's output data stream in order to make paper tray selection work as the driver has a bug which breaks this functionality. This patch for GPL Ghostscript 8.63 fixes the problem and allows to set the input tray with the "-dMediaPosition=X" commmand line option for Ghostscript. "X" is an integer number which depends on the printer model and tray. For HP "0" is usually the printer default, "1" automatic selection, "2" manual feed, "4" the upper, and "5" the lower tray. Note that for PCL 5/5e these numbers are different.

GPL Ghostscript 8.63 comes with a CUPS filter ("pstopxl") and 2 PPD files for the "pxlmono" and "pxlcolor" drivers. Note that you will need all the three patches mentioned here to make the options in the PPD files actually work. With this patch the filter and the PPDs will be made ready for PDF input.

The patches are all committed to the Subversion repository of GPL Ghostscript, so they are not needed any more in future versions (8.64 and later).
